me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.robot.components

Interface Motor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEncodedMotor, AbstractMotor, EmptyMotor, SimulatedMotor

    public interface Motor
    A (very simple) motor interface. For almost all purposes, it's generally a better idea to use a more abstract implementation of this interface.
    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    AbstractMotor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getPower()
      Get a power value from the motor.
      void setPower(double power)
      Set power to the motor.

    • Method Detail

      • getPower

        double getPower()
        Get a power value from the motor. This method should return whatever power the motor is currently operating at.

        In some cases, it may be preferable to store a value inside of the program instead of polling the motor to determine the power it's operating at. This can preserve some CPU cycles, but to be honest, the difference is minimal.

        Returns:
        the motor's current power.

      • setPower

        void setPower(double power)
        Set power to the motor.

        Typically, this power value should fit within the range of -1.0 to +1.0. This isn't required, but it's common enough I feel I should make a note of it.

        Parameters:
        power - the power value to set to the motor.
